revised_title: Embryonic Development of Wolffian Body and Duct in Mice
tldr: This study examines the embryonic development of the Wolffian body and duct, as well as the Mullerian duct, in mice. The research focuses on the differentiation of sex, the formation of the germinal ridge, and the urogenital union in both male and female mice. The findings provide important insights into the development of the gonads and their connections to the urogenital system.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
